articles.title: jQuery 1.6 Beta 1 Released

snippet.text: John Resig unveils the first beta of the forthcoming jQuery 1.6. He asks you to help out by dropping that code into your existing application and letting them know if anything no longer works

articles.title: Official jQuery Plugins: A Change in The Roadmap

snippet.text: There hasn't been a dedicated team for supporting official jQuery plugins but as they've become increasingly more important and complex, it seems time to lay down a policy. Adam Sontag explains

articles.title: The Node Beginner Book

snippet.text: is a new, free, single-page 'book' that aims to get you started with developing applications for node.js, teaching you everything you need to know about "advanced" JavaScript along the way

articles.title: SproutCore 1.5 Released (1.6 due in June)
Ruby on Rails 3.1 To Adopt CoffeeScript and jQuery
Coming Soon: O'Reilly's 'Stateful JavaScript Applications'
Modern JavaScript: An Ecosystem Analysis

snippet.text: JavaScript guru Rebecca Murphey casts her eye across the JavaScript ecosystem and ponders its strengths and weaknesses while suggesting a way forward

articles.title: How To Get Started with Object-Oriented JavaScript Code

snippet.text: In an article for IBM DeveloperWorks, Kris Hadlock quickly explains how you can get started with OOP in JavaScript through creating and using custom objects

articles.title: Douglas Crockford 'Actual JavaScript Engine Performance' Test

snippet.text: Douglas Crockford says that most JavaScript benchmarks are not representative of the behavior of real web applications and shows off his own results based on JSLint. This has been controversial though and it shows IE 10 as a clear winner in the performance stakes

articles.title: What's New in jQuery UI 1.8?

snippet.text: Malcolm Sheridan has a quick look at the latest version of the jQuery UI library and demonstrates the new AutoComplete and Button widgets

articles.title: A New jQuery.attr and the New jQuery.prop Method in jQuery 1.6

snippet.text: Timmy Willison looks at the rewrite of jQuery.attr and the new jQuery.prop method that are in the forthcoming jQuery 1.6 and clears up some confusion that jQuery.fn.attr users may encounter on upgrading

articles.title: About That Hybrid 'V8Monkey' Engine

snippet.text: Paul O'Shannessy of Mozilla was wondering why there was no implementation of Node.js for the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine. Due to Node's tight coupling to Google V8, he and a few other developers set out to build a V8 API on top of SpiderMonkey

articles.title: Scraping the Web with Node.io

snippet.text: Node.io is a newish (we covered it in issue 3) screen scraping framework that allows you to easily scrape data from websites using Javascript. This blog post by Ben Dowling demonstrates how to use it to scrape multiple pages

articles.title: Multi-touch game controller in JavaScript/HTML5 for iPad
Improved V8 External Array Support with Node.JS's 'Buffer' Type (Node Geeks Only!)
CoffeeScript Basics in 25 Minutes

snippet.text: Charles Max Wood has put together a solid 25 minute introductory screencast for CoffeeScript, an increasingly popular language that compiles into JavaScript (and which will be a dependency of the next major version of Ruby on Rails

articles.title: Multiplayer Gaming with HTML5: Are We Ready?
forever: Keep a JS Script Running Continuously

snippet.text: forever is a simple tool for ensuring that a given script runs continuously. You can use forever through the command line interface or by requiring a module in your code

articles.title: JQuery-AHM: Reducing Ajax Requests to 1 Line

snippet.text: jquery-ahm is a replacement for $.ajax. With $.ajax, every Ajax request needs a callback but ahm reduces javascript code by letting the response data define the callbacks

articles.title: rosie: Object Factories for JavaScript

snippet.text: Rosie is a factory for easily building JavaScript objects, mostly useful for setting up test data. It takes inspiration from Ruby's factory_girl

articles.title: PDP-11 (1970s Minicomputer) Emulator in JavaScript
JSLintMate: JSLint (or JSHint) in the TextMate editor
Spine: A JS MVC Framework With A Different Take to Backbone.js
Sudoku Solver in CoffeeScript - A Code Snippet
Chrysaora: WebGL + JavaScript Powered Jellyfish

snippet.text: If you have a WebGL-compatible browser this is a stunning demo of 3D rendering and, even better, both the GLSL shader code and JavaScript code are easily found under View Source. The future is coming

articles.title: Simple Algorithms (Illustrated using JavaScript)

snippet.text: An interesting interactive demonstration of several simple algorithms and data structures (hash tables, binary search, bubble sort) using JavaScript
